intro: Graffenrieda obtusa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved graffenrieda, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many tropical shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
